concise_definition: n. 耳语, 低语, 轻声细语; v. 耳语, 低语

definitions.explanation_en: A very soft, quiet voice used when speaking, often to avoid being overheard or to convey secrecy or intimacy.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指说话时声音非常轻柔、低沉，通常是为了避免被他人听到，或为了传达秘密或亲密感。
definitions.example_en: The only sounds in the forest were the whispers of the wind through the trees.
definitions.example_cn: 森林里唯一的声响，是风穿过树叶时的低语。

definitions.explanation_en: A rumor or piece of information passed quietly or unofficially, often without clear source or confirmation.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指一种未经证实、悄悄流传的谣言或信息，通常没有明确的来源。
definitions.example_en: There were whispers that the CEO might resign before the end of the year.
definitions.example_cn: 有传言说，首席执行官可能在年底前辞职。

definitions.explanation_en: To speak very softly, using the breath rather than the full voice, often to avoid detection or to express intimacy.
definitions.explanation_cn: 以极轻的声音说话，主要依靠气息而非声带发声，通常是为了不被发现或表达亲密感。
definitions.example_en: She whispered her secret to her best friend in the dark.
definitions.example_cn: 她在黑暗中向最好的朋友低声说出了自己的秘密。

definitions.explanation_en: To be rumored or suggested indirectly, often in hushed tones or through subtle hints.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指某种信息或传闻通过含蓄的暗示或低语的方式间接流传。
definitions.example_en: Whispers of corruption began to circulate after the audit was published.
definitions.example_cn: 审计报告发布后，关于腐败的流言开始悄然流传。

comparison.analysis: “Murmurs”（低语、喃喃声）通常指持续、模糊、不清晰的低声说话，常用于描述群体中零散的议论或不安的声响，带有轻微的混乱感。而 “whispers” 更强调个体刻意的轻声说话，目的性更强，常与秘密或亲密相关。
“Rumors”（谣言）是未经证实的信息本身，强调内容的传播和可信度问题；而 “whispers” 作为名词时，强调的是信息传播的方式——轻声、隐秘、非正式。可以说，whispers 是 rumors 的传播渠道，而非信息内容本身。
“Mutterings”（嘟囔）指含糊不清、通常因不满或自言自语而发出的声音，常带有情绪色彩（如愤怒、抱怨），且不一定有意图让他人听见。而 “whispers” 是有意识地降低音量，目的是让特定对象听见，语义上更含蓄、更克制。
